intro: Barbacenia graciliflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered barbacenia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, elongated flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique appearance. Barbacenia graciliflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
